vision.notes: Large eyes suggest reliance on vision, potentially adapted for low-light conditions in deep waters. Found at depths ranging from 0-1000m.

chemoreception.notes: Likely plays a role in prey detection and mate recognition, as in most fishes. Presence of ink sac suggests a role in predator avoidance, which would involve detection of released ink and potentially conspecific alarm signals.

mechanoreception.notes: Lateral line system likely present, enabling detection of water movement and pressure changes for prey detection and predator avoidance.
